choices: Yields move inversely to bond prices. The one-month bill's yield skidded more than 61 basis points to wrap up the session at 2.347%, its third-steepest drop since July 31, 2001. The benchmark 10-year Treasury rose 10/32, lowering its yield to 4.634%.

text: If the quantity's general type is 'Macroeconomic / General Economic Conditions', please label the specific macroeconomic indicator. Select 'None of the above' if the quantity is not relevant to the U.S. economy or is not a macroeconomic / general conditions type.
